reviews.text: Staff were very helpful, I am a wheelchair user and they had the ramp ready for me to get onto my train and promptly phoned London Paddington to ensure they had a ramp ready too. When I was getting the train back there later that day, there was a member of staff on the platform to get me off the train as soon as the doors opened.
It's a great station with staff to help you, departure times ( departure Bord) information Bord and office

I used to go here to meet my ex Jason Simper in 1997 to see him off when I used to travel a long way to see him. The bridge has memories for me kissing him goodbye with tears on a Saturday and the last train back to London was so early 6pm!
Friendly staff there and always clean

It was an OK station with good facilities such as toilets, a ticket office and shops. Step free access to the Swansea and Barry lines is provided via a footbridge with lifts and trains seem to be consistent enough, if not, short formed form time to time.
